bibl.title: Accounting in BM 1075.
Proceedings of the 20th International Congress of Papyrologists
bibl.author: MacCOULL, Leslie S.B.

bibl.note: In BM 1075 (British Library Ms. Or. 6046) a single Egyptian village is generating almost five pounds of gold in tax revenue. Amounts are recorded in two different kinds of terms, in (notional) gold (i.e. money of account) and in bronze (i.e. the actual small currency in circulation).
MacCOULL Leslie S.B., Accounting in BM 1075.
Proceedings of the 20th International Congress of Papyrologists (Copenhagen, 1994) pp. 484-487.
